title: NorthStar pivots to Rocket Lab following Virgin Orbit’s collapse
summary: Canada’s NorthStar Earth and Space has signed a multi-launch deal with Rocket Lab after Virgin Orbit’s bankruptcy shattered plans to start deploying its space situational awareness (SSA) satellites this summer.

title: SpaceLogistics Secures 3 Orders For New Robotic Maintenance & Boosting Spacecraft Set To Launch 2025
summary: SpaceLogistics have secured three orders for there Mission Extension Pods (MEPs); a cutting-edge pod spacecraft providing boosts to geostationary satellites, set to launch on its first mission in 2025.

title: Kuva Space Wins Hyperspectral Data Award
summary: Finland's Kuva Space, previously known as Reaktor Space Lab, has secured a lucrative hyperspectral data contract worth 5 million euros ($5.47 million) from the European Commission.

title: Glaze Spells Out Priorities if Budget Cuts Materialize
summary: Lori Glaze, director of NASA’s Planetary Science Division, told an advisory committee today how she will prioritize activities if budget cuts stemming from the recent debt limit deal materialize. She […]

title: Ecuador signs Artemis Accords
summary: Ecuador joined the growing roster of countries backing the Artemis Accords for safe and sustainable space exploration June 21.

title: Ship 25 begins engine testing as Starship launch pad work continues
summary: Two months after Starship’s first integrated test flight, engine testing is already underway for Ship 25, the ship that will fly on the second launch of Starship. At the same time, SpaceX is approaching the final stretch of completing the foundation work needed at the orbital launch mount (OLM) from where Super Heavy and Starship are set to lift off again no earlier than August. Ship 25 conducted a Spin Prime test on Wednesday.

title: The Atlantic tropics are on fire—it already looks like August out there
summary: Tropical Storm Bret has formed, and Cindy may not be far behind. It's June.

title: Intelsat ends merger talks with rival satellite communications giant SES
summary: U.S. satellite communications giant Intelsat walked away from merger discussions with Luxembourg-based competitor SES on Wednesday, CNBC confirmed.

title: NASA, Department of Agriculture Advance Exploration, Science
summary: NASA and the USDA (U.S. Department of Agriculture) signed a memorandum of understanding Wednesday strengthening the collaboration between the two agencies, including efforts to improve agricultural and Earth science research, technology, agricultural management, and the application of science data and models to agricultural decision making.

title: Mynaric to supply laser communications for Raytheon’s missile-tracking satellites
summary: Mynaric will supply laser communications terminals for seven military satellites made by Raytheon Technologies, the company announced June 21.
